Sequence Information.Peptide Name: AM-CATH21 (AM-CATH36 fragment, or As-CATH4 fragtment, AS-21, Lys-rich, Synthetic AMPs, UCLL1)

Literature Information.Literature: Discovery: sequence alignment to identify the conserved cathelin domain followed by AMP mapping.Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is most similar (58.33%) toAM-CATH36k: 38%; L=F=R: 14%.Activity: active against A. baumannii ATCC 9955 or ATCC BAA-1794 (MIC 1.6-3.9 uM), E-faecalis ATCC 22192 or 51299 (MIC > 16 uM), E. coli ATCC 4157 (MIC 7.9-53 uM), K. pneumoniae ATCC 33495 or ATCC BAA-1705 (MIC 2.0-11.0 uM), P. aeruginosa ATCC 9027 or ATCC BAA-2110 (MIC 3.9-16 uM), and S. aureus ATCC 25923 or 33592 (MIC 11 uM).Structure:  random coil in water and helical in 50% TFE or SDS.Toxicity: sheep RBC: <0.5% hemolysis at 300 ug/ml, not hemo.lytic. Also not toxic to human lung epithelial cells A549 at 100 ug/ml.
Literature Information.Author: Barksdale SM, Hrifko EJ, van Hoek ML. 2017
Literature Information.Title: Cathelicidin antimicrobial peptide from Alligator mississippiensis has antibacterial activity against multi-drug resistant Acinetobacter baumanii and Klebsiella pneumoniae.
